word: die Inflation, die In the case of "die inflation," the plural form remains the same as the singular form.
definition: A sustained and general increase in prices of goods and services in an economy over a period of time, typically resulting in a decrease in the purchasing power of currency. It is often measured by the Consumer Price Index (CPI) and is a key economic indicator.

examples.german: Die hohe Inflation führt zu steigenden Preisen.
examples.english: High inflation leads to rising prices.

examples.german: Die Inflation hat die Kaufkraft stark beeinflusst.
examples.english: Inflation has greatly affected purchasing power.

examples.german: Die Inflation wird durch die Geldmenge beeinflusst.
examples.english: Inflation is influenced by the money supply.

examples.german: Die Inflation kann zu einer Wirtschaftskrise führen.
examples.english: Inflation can lead to an economic crisis.
